Message.Title: DeviceNet master/slave board is missing
Message.Description: The DeviceNet master/slave board does not work.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Devicenet is possible.
Message.Causes: The DeviceNet master/slave board is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure a DeviceNet master/slave board is installed.
2. Replace the board if faulty.

Message.Title: Second DeviceNet master/slave board is missing
Message.Description: Dual option is configured but only one DeviceNet master/slave board is installed.
Message.Consequences: Only one DeviceNet bus is available.
Message.Causes: The Second DeviceNet master/slave board is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure a Second DeviceNet master/slave board is installed.
2. Replace the Second board if faulty.

Message.Title: Incompatible DeviceNet Boards
Message.Description: The system has detected incompatible types of DeviceNet boards.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the DeviceNet is possible.
Message.Causes: Incompatible types of DeviceNet boards have been installed in the system.
Message.Actions: Make sure that compatible board types are installed.

Message.Title: Profibus-DP master/slave board is missing
Message.Description: The Profibus-DP master/slave board does not work.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Profibus-DP master/slave board is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure a Profibus-DP master/slave board is installed.
2. Replace the board if faulty.

Message.Title: Profibus board update error
Message.Description: The RobotWare software was not able to download new driver software to the Profibus-DP master/slave board. The channel (ch ) of the Profibus board could not be programmed. Internal error code:.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare software may be corrupt or the board hardware may be malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system to reattempt downloading the software.
2. Reinstall the present system files.
3. Create and run a new system to download the driver software.
4. Replace the board if faulty.

Message.Title: Profibus-DP master/slave board failure
Message.Description: The Profibus-DP master/slave board did not start up correctly.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Profibus-DP master/slave board hardware may be malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system.
2. Replace the Profibus-DP master/slave board if faulty.

Message.Title: Profibus-DP master/slave board internal error
Message.Description: The Profibus-DP master/slave board reported internal error .
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Profibus-DP master/slave board hardware may be malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system.
2. Replace the Profibus-DP master/slave board if faulty.

Message.Title: Profibus startup error
Message.Description: - Profibus master bus error Error code . Check cabling, terminators and modules then restart.

Message.Title: Profibus Bus Error
Message.Description:
Profibus master bus error.
Internal error
Error code .
Message.Consequences: Certain expected associated errors may be delayed.
Message.Causes:
Faulty profibus cabling, terminators and/or module(s).
Duplicated profibus addresses.
Message.Actions: Check cabling, terminators and modules.

Message.Title: Profibus bus OK
Message.Description: - Profibus regained contact on the master bus.

Message.Title: Profibus-DP master/slave board exception
Message.Description: A fatal error has occurred on the Profibus-DP master/slave board. channel in task . Parameters
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Profibus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Profibus-DP master/slave board hardware may be malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system.
2. Replace the Profibus-DP master/slave board if faulty.

Message.Title: Robot Communication Card is missing
Message.Description: The system cannot contact the Robot Communication Card.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the Safety System is possible. The system goes to status SYS FAIL.
Message.Causes: The Robot Communication Card is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure a Robot Communication Card is installed.
2. Replace the unit if faulty.

Message.Title: Incorrect RCC firmware
Message.Description: The FPGAR11-Firmware on the RCC (DSQC602) is of an incompatible version. Current version: . Requested version: .
Message.Actions:
1. Replace the DSQC602 board
2. Restart the system

Message.Title: Can't find file
Message.Description: The system cannot find the file: []
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Requested info not in file
Message.Description: The system cannot find information about what software to download to HardWare ID="", Version="", Revision="" in file [].
Message.Causes: The file has either been damaged, or the actual hardware version of the unit is not supported.
Message.Actions:
1. Reinstall the system
2. Replace the unit to a version which is supported by this SW-release.

Message.Title: No Communication With The Safety System
Message.Description: There is no serial communication between the Safety System and the robot communication card.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS FAIL.
Message.Causes: Probably hardware fault in cable between Safety System and Robot Communication Card. The Safety System, or it's power supply, may also be faulty.
Message.Actions:
1) Restart the system to resume operation.
2) Make sure the cable between robot communication card and Safety System is working and correctly connected.
3) Check the Safety System power supply.
4) Replace the unit if faulty.

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware reflash started
Message.Description: In drive module , a required upgrade of the firmware in the drive unit at unit position has started. The old firmware revision is replaced with revision .
Message.Actions: Wait for the firmware upgrade process to complete. Do not turn off system power!

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware reflash complete
Message.Description: In drive module , the upgrade of the firmware in the drive unit with unit position is completed. New revision is .

Message.Title: Drive unit hardware not supported
Message.Description: In drive module , the system cannot use the drive unit with hardware identity because the hardware revision is not supported.
Message.Consequences: The system is unable to use the drive unit. The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare version is too old to support the drive unit.
Message.Actions:
1) Upgrade the system to a RobotWare version supporting the drive unit revision.
2) Replace the drive unit to one with compatible revision.

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware reflash failed
Message.Description: In drive module , the upgrade of the firmware in the drive unit at unit position failed.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the drive unit firmware is not performed.
Message.Actions:
1) Check other hardware eventlog messages for detailed explanation of the error condition.
2) Try again by restart the system using the main power switch.

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware file not found
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade a drive unit’s firmware, is not found.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the drive unit firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare installation does not contain the firmware file.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware file type error
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade a drive unit’s firmware, is of wrong type.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the drive unit firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare installation is faulty.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Drive unit firmware file error
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade a drive unit’s firmware, is not usable because it failed the integrity check.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the drive unit firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare installation is faulty.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Firmware reflash started
Message.Description: A required update of the firmware has started. File used: [].
Message.Actions: Wait for the reflash to complete

Message.Title: Firmware reflash completed
Message.Description: The update of firmware has completed successfully.

Message.Title: Firmware reflash failed
Message.Description:
The update of firmware failed.
Internal errorcode:
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for detailed explanation
2. Restart the system
3. Reinstall the system
4. Replace the

Message.Title: Firmware file is corrupt
Message.Description: The firmware file [] is corrupt. Internal errorcode:
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Firmware file not found
Message.Description: The firmware file [] is not found.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Safety System Unit Not Supported
Message.Description: The system cannot use the Safety System unit , revision .
Message.Consequences: The system is unable to use the affected hardware.
Message.Actions: 1. Change the affected hardware to a compatible version.

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware reflash started
Message.Description: In drive module , a required upgrade of the firmware in the axis computer with hardware identity has started. The old firmware revision is replaced with revision .
Message.Actions: Wait for the firmware upgrade process to complete. Do not turn off system power!

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware reflash complete
Message.Description: In drive module , the upgrade of the firmware in the axis computer with hardware identity is completed. New revision is .

Message.Title: Axis computer communication error
Message.Description: The system failed to communicate with the axis computer in drive module when trying to read firmware information.
Message.Consequences: The system is unable to determine if an upgrade is required of the firmware in the affected drive module. The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes: This may be due to a cable break, bad connector or high levels of interference in the cable between the main computer and the axis computer.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the cable between the main computer and the axis computer is not damaged and that both connectors are correctly connected.
2) Make sure no extreme levels of electromagnetic interference are emitted close to the robot cabling.

Message.Title: Axis computer hardware not supported
Message.Description: In drive module , the system cannot use the axis computer with hardware identity because the hardware revision is not supported.
Message.Consequences: The system is unable to use the axis computer. The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare version is too old to support the axis computer unit.
Message.Actions:
1) Replace the axis computer to one with compatible revision.
2) Upgrade the system to a RobotWare version supporting the axis computer revision.

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware reflash failed
Message.Description: In drive module , the upgrade of the firmware in the axis computer with hardware identity failed.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the axis computer firmware is not performed.
Message.Actions:
1) Check other hardware eventlog messages for detailed explanation of the error condition.
2) Retry again by restarting the system using the main power switch.

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware file not found
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade an axis computer’s firmware, is not found.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the axis computer firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The RobotWare installation does not contain the firmware file.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware file type error
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade an axis computer firmware, is of wrong type.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the axis computer’s firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The firmware file is corrupt.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Axis computer firmware file error
Message.Description: The file , required to upgrade an axis computer’s firmware, is not usable because it failed the integrity check.
Message.Consequences: The required upgrade of the axis computer firmware is not performed.
Message.Causes: The firmware file is corrupt.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Corrupt axis computer hardware
Message.Description: In drive module , the axis computer flash memory has a corrupt content.
Message.Actions:
1. Retry again by restarting the system using the main power switch.
2. If the problem remains then replace the axis computer.

Message.Title: Firmware reflash started
Message.Description: A required update of the firmware has started. Replacing old firmware version: [].
Message.Actions: Wait for the reflash to complete

Message.Title: Firmware reflash completed
Message.Description: The update of firmware has completed successfully. New version: []. Internal code:[]

Message.Title: Firmware reflash failed
Message.Description:
The upgrade of firmware failed.
Current version:. Internal errorcode:.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other hardware eventlog messages for detailed explanation of the error condition.
2. Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Unable to download firmware file
Message.Description: The firmware file is not found. Internal error code:.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Corrupt axis computer hardware
Message.Description: The flash memory has a corrupt content. Internal error code:.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other hardware eventlog messages for detailed explanation of the error condition.
2. Restart the system.
3. If failure occurs again, replace the axis computer.

Message.Title: Found no axis computer board
Message.Description: System failed to detect any connected axis computer.
Message.Actions:
1. Check system for axis computer board.
2. Check ethernet cables between the main computer and the axis computer.
3. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Axis firmware: No communication
Message.Description: The system failed to communicate with axis board when trying to check the firmware version.
Message.Consequences: The system is unable to check and if necessary upgrade the firmware in the affected axis computer.
Message.Actions:
1. Check system for axis computer board.
2. Check ethernet cables between the main computer and the axis computer.
3. Restart system.

Message.Title: Axis computer hardware data error
Message.Description: In drive module , the axis computer has corrupt information stored on the unit.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes: The integrity check of the axis computer information stored on the unit has failed.
Message.Actions:
1) Retry again by restarting the system using the main power switch.
2) Replace the faulty axis computer.

Message.Title: Firmware reflash started
Message.Description:
A required update of the firmware has started. Internal code: [].
File: [].
Message.Actions: Wait for the reflash to complete

Message.Title: Firmware reflash completed
Message.Description: The update of firmware has completed successfully . Internal code:[]
Message.Actions: No action required

Message.Title: Firmware reflash failed
Message.Description:
The update of firmware failed.
Internal errorcode:
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for detailed explanation.
2. Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Firmware file corrupt
Message.Description:
The update of firmware failed.
The firmware file [] is corrupt.
Internal errorcode:.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Firmware file not found
Message.Description:
The update of firmware failed.
The firmware file [] is not found.
Internal errorcode:.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: No Safety System Found By Axis Computer
Message.Description: Axis computer failed to detect the Safety System.
Message.Actions:
1. Check communication cables between the axis computer and the Safety System.
2. Check power supply to the Safety System.
3. Restart the system

Message.Title: Firmware reflash started
Message.Description:
A required update of the firmware in drive module has started.
File: [].
Message.Actions: Wait for the reflash to complete, this will take approximately 3.5 minutes.

Message.Title: Firmware reflash completed
Message.Description: The update of firmware in drive module has sucessfully completed.
Message.Actions: No action required

Message.Title: Firmware reflash failed
Message.Description: The update of firmware in drive module has failed.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for detailed explanation.
2. Reinstall the system.

Message.Title: Firmware file corrupt
Message.Description:
The update of firmware in drive module has failed.
The firmware file [] is corrupt.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Firmware file not found
Message.Description:
The update of firmware in drive module has failed.
The firmware file [] is not found.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system

Message.Title: Interbus master/slave board is missing
Message.Description: The Interbus master/slave board does not work.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Interbus is possible.
Message.Causes: The Interbus master/slave board is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure a Interbus master/slave board is installed.
2) Replace the board if faulty.

Message.Title: Serial port hardware is not accessible
Message.Description: The system has tried to address the serial port , and failed.
Message.Consequences: The optional serial port hardware can not be accessed. The connector and the physical channel using the connector will not be available for use.
Message.Causes: The serial port hardware is missing or malfunctioning.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the required serial port hardware has been correctly installed and is not faulty.
2) Replace the serial port hardware.

Message.Title: Revolution counter update failure
Message.Description: Update of the revolution counter for joint failed.
Message.Consequences: Joint not synchronized
Message.Causes:
1. Joint missing or not active
2. Measurement system error
Message.Actions:
1. Check if joint active
2. Check configuration files
3. Check measurement system

Message.Title: Fieldbus Adapter is missing
Message.Description: The Fieldbus Adapter is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the Fieldbus Adapter is possible.
Message.Causes: The Fieldbus Adapter is either malfunctioning or missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure a Fieldbus Adapter is installed.
2. Replace the module if faulty.

Message.Title: Drive system not supported
Message.Description: The configured drive system in drive module is not of type Drive System '04.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes:
1. Wrong drive module key used, i.e., the configuration does not match hardware.
2. Wrong hardware used in the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Reinstall the system with a drive module key that matches the hardware.
2. Replace the drive module with one that supports Drive System '04.

Message.Title: Drive system not supported
Message.Description: The configured drive system in drive module is not of type Drive System '09.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to System Failure state.
Message.Causes:
1. Wrong drive module key used, i.e., the configuration does not match hardware.
2. Wrong hardware used in the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Reinstall the system with a drive module key that matches the hardware.
2. Replace the drive module with one that supports Drive System '09.

Message.Title: Lost communication with all drive units
Message.Description: In drive module , the axis computer has lost communication with all drive units.
Message.Consequences: No operation will be possible until the fault is corrected. The system goes to Motors Off state with zero torque.
Message.Causes: Communication problem between drive units and the axis computer.
Message.Actions:
1) Check that all cables are properly connected.
2) Check that the drive units have logic power.
3) Check/replace Ethernet cables.
4) Check for other hardware eventlog messages.
5) Check the event log for power supply unit error messages.
6) Check the cabling between the power supply unit and the drive unit.
7) Check the 24V output from the power supply unit.
